Name: Hydrogen
Description: Hydrogen is a chemical element with atomic number 1. It is the lightest element on the periodic table. Its monatomic form (H) is the most abundant chemical substance in the Universe.

Name: Oxygen
Description: Oxygen is a chemical element with atomic number 8. It is a highly reactive nonmetal, and an oxidizing agent that readily forms oxides with most elements as well as with other compounds. By mass, oxygen is the third-most abundant element in the universe, after hydrogen and helium

Name: Water
Description: Water is a transparent chemical substance that is the main constituent of Earth's streams, lakes, and oceans, and the fluids of most living organisms. Its molecule contains one oxygen and two hydrogen atoms that are connected by covalent bonds
